Package ch.danielhoop.utils

Class ArgumentInterpreter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.danielhoop.utils.ArgumentInterpreter
  • public class ArgumentInterpreter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to interpret command line arguments and convert them into a Java Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgumentInterpreter

        public ArgumentInterpreter​(java.lang.String[] minimumArgs,
                           java.lang.String[] maximumArgs,
                           boolean allowEmptyArgs,
                           boolean allowSingleHyphen,
                           boolean caseSensitiveSingleHyphen,
                           boolean allowDoubleHyphen,
                           boolean caseSensitiveDoubleHyphen)
        param allowEmptyArgs If true, then empty arguments without a value are allowed. Instead of "--verbose true" you can then use "--verbose".
        Parameters:
        minimumArgs - The minimum required arguments that must be given.
        maximumArgs - The maximum arguments that can be given.
        allowEmptyArgs - Boolean value indicating if empty arguments (i.e. --verbose) without a following text should be allowed
        allowSingleHyphen - If true, then arguments like '-a' will be accepted. Notice that '-ab value' will be sliced into two arguments 'a'->'' and 'b'->'value'.
        caseSensitiveSingleHyphen - Boolean value indicating if single hyphen arguments should be case sensitive.
        allowDoubleHyphen - If true, then arguments like '--arg' will be accepted.
        caseSensitiveDoubleHyphen - Boolean value indicating if double hyphen arguments should be case sensitive.

    • Method Detail

      • readArgs

        public ArgumentInterpreter readArgs​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Method to interpret command line arguments and convert them into a Map.
        Parameters:
        args - Array of arguments as given by the command line. Arguments can look like -asdf OR --asdf
        Returns:
        A map that contains the name of each given argument (key) with corresponding value. Note that - and -- will not be contained in the keys.
